title: I need font help. I'm stuck in the world of Gotham and Interstate
content:
Hi everyone. I'm designing a book that features Apolline as it's main display font. [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/typofonderie/apolline/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201042849/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typofonderie/apolline/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/typofonderie/apolline/")

This book has a lot of elements (a-heads, b-heads, lists, bullets, etc.) that I need a sans for. It's a simple, elegant, clean design. I've been creatively stuck on Gotham and Interstate. Does anyone have an alternative suggestion to get me out of my transportation rut?

Thank you in advance-Janet
author: Plaidjaney

comments.content:
Avenir is a great substitute for Gotham, as well as Museo and Proxima Nova. There are many alternatives...Frutiger/Myriad, Franklin Gothic/Trade Gothic, Gill Sans/Agenda...just off the top.

Jeo.

[Figgins Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201042849/http:/www.shinntype.com/figgins.html), with its long extenders, would match Apolline.  
It has all the bells and whistles for book work.
Thank you for all of these suggestions. I'm trying them out now...

I love Apolline! I usually companion it with Parisine, also by Porchez Typofonderie.

I've also recently companioned it with TheMix and Hypatia on separate projects.
Ken-Awesome. Amazing. Thank you-I think I found "the one" ;o)
